attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

skillTree.localised_description: Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Nurglish factions

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: And so I travelled North, following the winds to the terrible gate between worlds.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +5 per turn

skillTree.localised_description: Tremble before me, mortals!

skillTree.localised_description: The Great Schemer tempts his followers with forbidden knowledge the same way a fisherman coaxes a carp onto his hook with a succulent worm.

skillTree.localised_description: Raw Chaos energy is deadlier than any poison.

skillTree.localised_description: With me at your back, nothing shall defeat us!

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +25

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

skillTree.localised_description: Delighting in death and suffering, these savage warriors follow their ignoble Lord wherever he goes.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

Speed: +6% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The razor-sharp hail of the north is not the only danger in the Norscan sky – its airborne beasts are just as deadly and far less predictable.

skillTree.localised_description: Giant, deadly, and able to take orders, this Lord’s monstrosities are especially terrifying and lethal.

skillTree.localised_description: In spite of their savage nature, they are possessed of a savage code of conduct and form a loose brotherhood of those considered worthy.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: No beast too large, no adversary too great; no quarry - mortal or otherwise - can evade them.

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls, Chaos Frost Dragon, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls, Chaos Frost Dragon, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 8% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls, Chaos Frost Dragon, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +20% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.
Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +200
	(Lord's army)
Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Blades that burn through magical protections, scintillating barriers that deflect blows. Azrik leads a warband of terrifying magical might.

	(Lord's army)
